posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
The Brawler

Greetings all! Hope you are keeping well. 

This is another build draft idea to share. This has:
- Monk 35 for very high spell resistance, very high speed, lots of attacks, mind/poison/disease immunity, empty body (35 round duration 50% concealment 2x/day)
- Sorc 1 for prerequisites for RDD, spellcraft skill dump, to use sorc wands (ie lesser spell breach) and items
- RDD 4 for +4 strength and +1 AC, search skill dump
- Half-Orc to help with Str, 20% exp penalty from 21 - 40
- Dev crit 

Originally I tried to make a 'pure' half-orc monk like Torias's Ultimate Monk build, who is a builder I like very much, it has an AB of 39, SR 55.
I thought trading 5 monk levels (7 SR) for Sorc 1 RDD 4, as more powerful, as it grants 4 great strengths, +1 AC, skill dumps and access to sorc equipment.
I couldn't find any ECB builds with Monk 35 with RDD 4.

The other sources of inspiration from other builders I enjoy reading were: 
Valerfor's The Iron Fist, ultimate version, half-orc, dev crit, gets an AB of 41, SR 49, has BAB 26+ and EWS.
Empyre's Order of the Wyrm, Monk 25 / Sorc 1 / RDD 14, has Str 38 and AB 42 + HP, less spell resistance

I go ultra high spell resistance (ISR VI) here as mages are the enemy.
In less mage heavy environments, one can drop three ISR + EP for four great strengths, mundane Str 34, AB 41, SR 51
And additionally drop dev crit for six great strengths, mundane Str 38, AB 42, SR 51, drop power attack and great cleave for more saves feats for a higher Fort save.
One could adjust the stats to drop dex and wis down in exchange for +2 str and hit Str 40 / AB 43, but it didn't make sense to trade 3 AC for 1 AB / DMG, or a large number of skill points which would have made the build less fun to play. (Edit: AB calculation for modifications fixed)

Other normal sized races are good too. Elf, human, dwarf all come to mind as good options. Not sure really what I like best here. 
Elves get to use longswords, rapiers and longbows and have keen senses, probably leaning towards that.

Some stats:

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
RDD 4 is an old classic. It offers what you said and can be a good choice if you don't have room for the full 10 levels. Here you said you want a high SR. Then it makes sense.
But on the other side, you give up a lot for that extra SR.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Those are good thoughts Mick
I think I was trying to explore the RDD 4 idea and try to find a build which works with it.
Perhaps I should look into an RDD 10+ and just forget about the ultra high SR
Empyre's Order of the Wyrm's split I think is probably best with Monk 25 / Sorc 1 / RDD 14.
I can create a H/O Monk with mundane 42 Str / 45 AB this way, 450hp. Dev crit Fort DC 46 - 52.
When I look at that monk it looks scarier to face. 
SR is only 35, so dedicated casters will have no trouble passing their checks, although against UMD users and spellswords the SR will be useful
